body: No update in one week.

> Review comment should only be resolved by reviewer, not pr owner. Please don't do that.

ok
Do you mean AWS SQS? It depends on which client lib do you use. We have plenty of MQ plugin like kafka, activemq, you could learn from it.
woo, nice idea!
@karott I fixed the problem of `mdc` array out of bounds, can you try again?

Thanks for reply. I will dig a little more about, reopening again.

In existing design, running context should be managed by plugin, but if it is for safer, I am om with that.
@wu-sheng  @acurtain  I've completed.
I am not familiar with this. Do you know anyone to test?

@zhangkewei is the plugin author,  can you review this pr？

Not support async append log.
English only. We don't assign jobs of plugin to our contributors. We depend on volunteers and contributes. Supported list includes all supported versions.

> Some point were left out:
> -handleRetryRollbacking
> -handleRetryCommitting
> -handleAsyncCommitting
> -LockManager

Hi @CoffeeLatte007 , thanks for reviewing, the `LockManager` instrumentation is added(as the trace below.

As for the three `handleXxx` methods, they are indeed not instrumented, but the underlying operations (`BranchCommit`, `BranchRollback`) are instrumented, therefore the interactions between TC and TM/RM are in trace links.

I think it's enough to show the interactions between TC and TM/RM, instrumenting the three methods just adds some local spans, without more detailed information?

Please correct me if I'm wrong. Thanks :-)


![SkyWalking](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/59093894-88a97100-8947-11e9-875f-5fd145e034d3.png)

I've updated the newly-added dependencies list in my original comment, there're fewer **because last time I compared the master branch with the latest released version**, and there're some dependencies that are introduced by other commits (e.g. dependency `io.sundr:sundr-core:jar:0.9.2` is introduced by [this PR](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/pull/2460/files#diff-7c61192cd2fd51bddd8930cc37842523R42) as a transitive dependency of kubernetes):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/59108763-3def1f80-896e-11e9-8994-56dc14e70c9f.png)

> > Some point were left out:
> > -handleRetryRollbacking
> > -handleRetryCommitting
> > -handleAsyncCommitting
> > -LockManager
> 
> Hi @CoffeeLatte007 , thanks for reviewing, the `LockManager` instrumentation is added(as the trace below.
> 
> As for the three `handleXxx` methods, they are indeed not instrumented, but the underlying operations (`BranchCommit`, `BranchRollback`) are instrumented, therefore the interactions between TC and TM/RM are in trace links.
> 
> I think it's enough to show the interactions between TC and TM/RM, instrumenting the three methods just adds some local spans, without more detailed information?
> 
> Please correct me if I'm wrong. Thanks :-)
> 
> ![SkyWalking](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15965696/59093894-88a97100-8947-11e9-875f-5fd145e034d3.png)

The underlying operations are used in many methods. We don't know which method is using it.
I will add a new mode of exporter and make this possible to implement.
Zipkin receiver is experimental. We requires that tag.

Also, you CI is failing, please fix it.

We support, but first not production ready, we said very clearly in our document, then, we need those tags today. If you want to support this feature, I could assist you, but SkyWalking PMC are interesting in SkyWalking native agents more, and our users are too.

I am back online. For this pull request, please read this PR #2640 .  Your #2817 is easy to merge because of that. 

All dependency libs must be added to LICENSE file in dist folder. For Apache 2.0, NOTICE file content should be added to our NOTICE. Other licenses should be copied. These include the `io.sundr:sundr-core:jar:0.9.2`, if we missed that when we updated the k8s client version.

> Also, you CI is failing, please fix it.

It's weird that it failed on OracleJDK but passed on OpenJDK, now the master branch failed too. I need to do some research on this
Because of `configuration-nacos`?

> @kezhenxu94 See this, https://travis-ci.org/apache/skywalking/builds/543132461 .
> Look like nacos test is not stable, read log https://travis-ci.org/apache/skywalking/jobs/543132463
> 
> We need to figure some method or remove this test case somehow.

The problem that Nacos starts timeout has been resolved because the database is not initialized properly, now the reason why it fails became stable:


After Googling for a while, I cannot figure out why it happens yet.

It sill failed occasionally, and I did not figure out why after struggling half a day, I'm afraid that I have to remove the test case temporarily

> These include the `io.sundr:sundr-core:jar:0.9.2`, if we missed that when we updated the k8s client version.

HI @wu-sheng 

- [aopalliance](http://aopalliance.sourceforge.net) (**I'm NOT SURE about Public Domain**)

> LICENCE: all the source code provided by AOP Alliance is Public Domain.

**PUBLIC & NO NOTICE FILE** (`rsync -a a.cvs.sourceforge.net::cvsroot/aopalliance/`)

- apollo-client-1.4.0.jar and apollo-core-1.4.0.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NO LICENSE FILE**

- builder-annotations-0.9.2.jar resourcecify-annotations-0.9.2.jar sundr-codegen-0.9.2.jar
sundr-core-0.9.2.jar (https://github.com/sundrio/sundrio): **Apache 2.0 & NO NOTICE FILE**

- commons-compress-1.18.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NOTICE file contents are copied**

- fastjson-1.2.47.jar (**EXISTS in 6.1.0 and LICENSE is added**)

- guice-4.1.0.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NO NOTICE**

- javax.inject-1.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NO NOTICE**

- joda-convert-1.2.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NOTICE file contents are copied**

- nacos-api-1.0.0.jar nacos-client-1.0.0.jar nacos-common-1.0.0.jar: **Apache 2.0 & NO NOTICE file**
You need to cross check the difference between libs and existing license file.

> You need to cross check the difference between libs and existing license file.

I have the privilege, as I am project vp and apache officer. Send me your Apache id private, I will grant that to you.

But there some problem to assist the skywalking tracing with our rpc component which is in the [supported list](https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/Supported-list.md) (dubbox 2.8.4). It looks like they had some custom enhancement on the rpc component. So the next step, I will try to use the java againt and find out the compatibility problem. Thanks for your advise.

I just want to make sense that this issue if it caused by specify application, As your said any application can cause this issue, I will try to fix it.

Coverage increased (+0.002%) to 17.246% when pulling **e747bcc0dc095a2d0711a487f0d533963dc96c9c on envoy** into **2cdbe83f9c03aac6f8c085c687ac24184dff2366 on master**.

>there're methods like java.sql.PreparedStatement#setBinaryStream(int, java.io.InputStream, long), java.sql.PreparedStatement#setBlob(int, java.io.InputStream, long) and similar methods in PreparedStatement, should we collect them as well? The InputStream may be large and hard to display in tags, I would like to only collect their length and display something like InputStream[length] or anyone has better idea?

You could simply ignore them. I don't think we need to do this with such high payload. For `InputStream[length]`, I am not sure whether it is worth to do.
Also, based on this, your parameter tag value is not perfect. Thinking about these
1. If one parameter is ignored somehow, parameter list would match, unless you keep a `?` or `InputStream` or something to be a placeholder.
1. If the parameter includes `,`, what happens?
Also, active this in MySQL integration test case, and modify the test case, please.

> For `InputStream[length]`, I am not sure whether it is worth to do.

The reason why I'd like to do this is to make it a placeholder, as you said:

> If one parameter is ignored somehow, parameter list would match, unless you keep a ? or InputStream or something to be a placeholder.

keeping a `?` as placeholder is fine for me.

> If the parameter includes `,`, what happens?

quoting the parameter with `"` seems to be not perfect either, I'll think about this
Should we limit the length of string parameters?  The performance of Agent will be reduced if the values of SQL parameter are too large

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23900248/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23900248)

Coverage remained the same at 17.244% when pulling **bacae97bd824167648c55fc4ecdfdfc69beaea25 on kezhenxu94:polish** into **c983d85000b39d3258cd15c37d41682bd7f39329 on apache:master**.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/23900248/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/23900248)

Coverage remained the same at 17.244% when pulling **bacae97bd824167648c55fc4ecdfdfc69beaea25 on kezhenxu94:polish** into **c983d85000b39d3258cd15c37d41682bd7f39329 on apache:master**.

> Should we limit the length of string parameters? The performance of Agent will be reduced if the values of SQL parameter are too large

You mean truncating the final parameter string? 

If users active this config but not get the complete parameters, it would be useless sometimes (the useful parameters may be truncated).

I'd rather suggest the users not to active this config when the parameters are large/long, or just active during debugging.

It's disabled by default, so the users must pay for the performance themselves if we clearly documented this.

Just my own opinion, further discussion are very welcomed. @ascrutae

> Should we limit the length of string parameters? The performance of Agent will be reduced if the values of SQL parameter are too large

This could be argued too :) But for performance concern, I think @kezhenxu94 you could set a max parameter length config too.
Is your network good? You could check our CI, we build the UI and whole project every time, and it must pass before merge. Also, in ASF, we checked the release compiling too.

> quoting the parameter with " seems to be not perfect either, I'll think about this

Normally, I would say JSON Array should a good idea, but in agent, I think we don't have JSON lib today.

> > quoting the parameter with " seems to be not perfect either, I'll think about this
> 
> Normally, I would say JSON Array should a good idea, but in agent, I think we don't have JSON lib today.

There seems to be GSON already

Hi, 

To follow up after a whole night of debugging, I have found something. I do not know how to solve it, but certain internet networks can have a firewall configured that can block a specific port and not allow downloads for specific packages. I have found some solutions for other applications and tutorials where people have the same error:
```ruby 
Failed to execute goal com.github.eirslett:frontend-maven-plugin:1.6:npm (npm run build)
```
which involve opening a specific port to allow this plugin to be downloaded, but I do not know enough about networking to suggest this at my work. 

I fixed this by trying to compile at home, which had no problems. This network problem is unfortunately obfuscated by the not-so-helpful error messaging.

I know this is a common issue for many people from seeing the issues here, so I suggest to anyone if you do run into this issue to not fret and reinstall your node, npm versions etc. First try it on another network.

Coverage decreased (-0.004%) to 17.242% when pulling **da99c25a7b849cd96fd51796d633ae980cbaaf2b on dmsolr:solr-7.x-plugin** into **ec731b2ad800f3621e90902c8a44b959f7b10ad7 on apache:master**.

Here is a screenshot of solr collection. Obviously, it consists of 2 shards with 2 replicas per shard. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29735230/59269569-f7f1ce80-8c81-11e9-989f-621e84b31879.png)

In query, we omit  the replicas. One shard become a coordinator, when it receives a query from user. Because it is has a part of data in collection, It launch a request and send to others shards. Then coordinator have to merge the result that comes from all shards. In real scenario, it has serveral stages in usually.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29735230/59271095-b400c880-8c85-11e9-876f-6be077811fa2.png)
It seems like above picture.

In update, the documents need to be routed and send to corresponding shard. Then shard will copy it to they replicas.
Solr is a distributed database.
